postcontent: Great looking example of a M1888 Springfield Rifle with strong 1891 cartrouche on stock. This is the type with the ramrod bayonet. Serial #97,787 which makes the date of manufacture 1878. Interestingly, US armories used surplus parts leftover from older rifles to make additional M1888 rifles. This was done only in 1891 making this a more unique specimen. Breech Block dated 1884. Has what appears to be an old laquer job on stock giving it a somewhat shiny appearance but done in fine taste and not like some I've seen. A fine looking rifle at a very reasonable price. Only detractor is a very small and hardly noticeable hairline split less than a quarter inch in stock as seen in picture.

 CVA has completely redesigned the OPTIMA keeping all of the best features of the original while adding or improving many others. In fact, you’ll find features on the OPTIMA that are only found on other manufacturers’ most expensive guns. CVA’s OPTIMA includes our QRBP (Quick Release Breech Plug) – the only truly “tool-free removal” breech plug on the market today. Even after 20 or more shots, the QRBP comes out with just a twist of the fingers – try that with any other “speed breech” system.
 All OPTIMA rifles feature fluted barrels made of 416 grade stainless steel – and that’s real stainless steel, not some nickel plating or spray-on paint. Real stainless steel protects against corrosion on the outside and the inside of the barrel. The OPTIMA also has the same trigger design as our most expensive guns. This “zero center of gravity” design concept provides an incredibly light and smooth trigger pull with virtually no creep. The breech opens easily with just a touch of the breeching lever, which is located in the front of the trigger guard. The OPTIMA is available in both standard and thumbhole stock designs. Both are 100% ambidextrous, and available in either black or Realtree Hardwoods Green camo. On the standard stock model, the barrel is set up with all metal DuraSight Fiber Optic sights. The thumbhole model stock is ergonomically designed for scope shooters with DuraSight integral scope mounts included as standard equipment

postcontent: This is a knock around/loaner deer gun I've had for a number of years.  It is an original 1908 Mauser made in Germany by DWM Berlin for the Brazilian military contract.  Barrel and receiver match.  Bolt is a CZ from a VZ.24 Mauser with straight bolt handle stamped "circle Z".  Still has the Brazilian star crest on receiver, marked DWM Berlin, serial numbers, and model 1908.  Military rear sight.  No front sight.  Barrel shortened to 18"  5 shot magazine.  Stock was an original Husqvarna Model 98 sporter stock, buttplate is a Fajen.  Pistol grip with cap, checkering on forearm and pistol grip.  Nice wood with no cracks.   Has sling swivels.  Use as is, or change barrel and you'll have a really nice gun.  Original barrel has exterior pitting from being in the military stock for decades in storage, but does not affect shooting or function of the gun.  A bolt alone is worth $100 on Ebay, an action is $200, this wooden stock is $100 and can be used as a "drop in" for another Mauser action.   Price is $350 ftf or wil ship to your FFL. title: For Sale:  New MagPul FDE/Bushmaster AR Patrolman Carbine M4 Package!
postcontent:
For sale is a new 5.56/.223 Bushmaster AR Patrolman Carbine M4 style rifle with MagPul stock furniture in FDE (Flat Dark Earth).   Package comes with all Bushmaster OEM furniture and parts.  

Package Includes: 
Bushmaster Rifle (Patrolman Carbine with Removable Carry Handle) 
Hard Case and manual 
Bushmaster Magazine
MagPul MOE Stock FDE
MagPul MOE Forestock
MagPul Angled Foregrip
MagPul MOE Hand Grip
MagPul Trigger Guard
MagPul One Point Sling Attachment
MagPul 30 round PMag with window
Engraved Ejection Port Cover with Gadsen Flag and US Flag

This amazing package is for sale with low price tag of $1000 cash.   I am in the south metro area and would meet face to face for a private cash sale.  Bill of sale can be provided.  Just need to see permit to purchase or carry permit and valid driver’s license.  
Text, call, or email: 
952*215*4016

Bushmaster’s Product Description:
One of our most popular Carbine models, the M4 Type features a distinctive Military Barrel Profile and Six Position Telestock – great for 3 Gun Match Shooting, Home Defense and Law Enforcement use.
The Bushmaster A2 & A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbines are modeled after our M4 Type Carbines, but with additional barrel length to make them legal for sale to individual officers (semi-automatic configuration with 16" barrel). 

The 5.56mm/.223 Rem. caliber 16" barrel is chrome lined in both bore and chamber for long wear life and ease of maintenance. For control of muzzle flash and muzzle rise in rapid fire, a “birdcage” type suppressor is factory installed. A mil. spec. manganese phosphate outer coating insures protection against corrosion or rust on the barrel and all critical steel parts of the weapon. 

Forged, lightweight 7075T6 aircraft quality aluminum receivers are designed for simplicity of maintenance and reliability of operation and they incorporate all M16A2 design improvements including cartridge case deflector, bolt catch assembly and raised ribs for protection against accidental magazine release. A six position telescoping buttstock offers light weight, carrying ease and quick handling. 

The telestock, pistol grip and two piece handguards are all molded of strong black thermoset composite material. The handguards are internally shielded against barrel heat build-up. The dual aperture M16A2 rear sight system on these carbines offer both windage and elevation adjustment calibrated in meters. 

On the A2 Type - with fixed carry handle, adjustment range is from from 300 to 800 meters (1 Minute of Adjustment elevation and 1/2 M.o.A. windage). The A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbine includes a Removable Carry Handle - adjustment range is from from 300 to 600 meters (1/2 M.o.A. elevation and 1/2 M.o.A. windage).

Once the Carry Handle is removed, a wide variety of scopes, red dot or holographic sights, or night vision equipment may be mounted on the Upper Receiver’s integral Picatinny rail. Iron sight zero is completely repeatable when the handle is reattached by means of its knurled knobs. 

The Bushmaster A2/A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbines are shipped complete with 30 round magazine, safety and operational manual, and carrying sling.

Links to Bushmaster and Magpul

http://www.bushmaster.com/catalog_xm15_BCWA3F16M4.asp

http://store.magpul.com/

postcontent:
Our handgun familiarization class (HFC) is designed to provide new or future handgun owners with basic, yet informative hands-on instruction. 

Place your deposit for this Saturday's class. 

In this course, you'll learn how to safely store, handle, shoot, clean, and transport your revolver or semi-automatic pistol with confidence. 

If you do not already have a handgun, or if you would like to learn about other handguns, arrangements can be made to rent one of ours. We have Ruger, Glock, Smith and Wesson, Walther, and other firearms. 

We will teach this class to as little as four students. This class can take from two to four hours depending on the needs of the students attending. Generally it averages three hours in length including range time learning how to shoot with confidence. Students will learn the rules for safe gun handling; pistol parts and operation; ammunition; shooting fundamentals; cleaning the pistol; and continued opportunities for skill development. 

Students will also be introduced to training and using laser sights for personal and home defense. 

Contact us today for more information.

title: For Sale:  2 Mosin Nagant 91/30 Bolt Action Rifles
postcontent:
I've got two 1940's Mosin Nagants for sale here locally in Charlotte. They each come with sling, bayonet, and ammo pouch. As you can see both have their cleaning rods attached as well. If you'd like to purchase a small quantity of ammo to shoot right away I do have some I can part with so just let me know. Price is per rifle.

First one is a 1940 Tula. Numbers are matching on this one and bore is in good shape, just needs cleaned. That is the top rifle in the picture

Second is a 1942 Tula that has force matched bolt, butt plate, and floor plate. Trigger on this one is actually a little nicer than the '40 if you ask me. Again, good bore that just needs cleaned up.

I've not fired either of these but I have checked with a "No Go" headspace gauge and both appear to be safe to shoot. Please check with a professional if you do not feel that you are qualified to check these rifles out for operational safety. Both rifles still have cosmoline on them and the bores have not been cleaned so you'll want to clean them before taking to the range. I'd be happy to offer tips for anyone new to these. Tons of fun to shoot and probably the most affordable "big bore" rifle out there thanks to the availability of surplus ammo!

title: For Sale:  1933 Walther PPK 7.65mm
postcontent: Here is a pre-war commercial model Walther PPK in 32 ACP (7.65mm), all original and unmolested. Excellent shape and crisp bore. Only issues are small cracks in 80 yr old grips (common) and a non-vintage magazine. Has the desirable 90 degree safety and "crown N" proofmarks. The serial number dates it to 1933, the year Hitler came into power and such pistols became badges of rank for senior officers of the budding Third Reicht. By the end of WW2, these prestigious pistols came to the US as war souveniers via American heroes. By the 60s, it bacame closely associated with espionage as this exact pistol was the prefered carry gun of Ian Fleming's James Bond. Here is an early, top quality German-build example of one of the most regognizable and historic pistols of the 20th Century.

title: For Sale:  Handgun Safety Course July 7th at Henry County Gun Club
postcontent:
Get Your Handgun Carry Permit!

The Henry County Gun Club is once again conducting the Tennessee Handgun Safety Course required to receive your TN Handgun Carry Permit.

Class date:  July 7, 2012
Cost: 	  $65
Instructor:	  Brent Armstrong, NRA Certified Pistol Instructor
Location:	  Henry County Gun Club
                  1995 Goldston Spring Rd
                  Puryear, TN 38251

Registration:	REDACTED or www.n2ctraining.com
More info:	        www.henrycountygunclub.com
		        REDACTED

The Tennessee Handgun Safety Course is taught in two segments, four hours of classroom instruction and four hours on the range.  You will be required to score a minimum of 70% on a written test and 70% on a course of fire (33 of 48 shots).  

This course is designed for those who wish to obtain their TN Handgun Carry Permit, but is also suitable for those who are simply interested in learning about the basics of pistol shooting.  We will make your experience enjoyable regardless of your skill level, from novice to expert.

You will need to bring a functional and safe handgun (.22 caliber or larger), a minimum of 50 rounds of FACTORY ammunition (100 rounds recommended and no reloads allowed), eye and ear protection, pen and paper for taking notes.  Firearms should be transported to the facility in a case or holster.  No ammunition is allowed in the classroom.

Students should dress appropriately for the weather.  We will shoot the course of fire rain or shine.  Students should also pack a lunch since the club is in a remote location.  HCGC has a full service kitchen for your convenience.

Preregistration is required.  Class size is limited to 20 participants.  Please call REDACTED if you have questions or need more information. 
[img]www.n2ctraining.com[/img]
